last_episode_to_air.name: Chapter 8: Worst Case Scenario
last_episode_to_air.overview: The election of a new district attorney gives Ellis reason to hope. Later, a hush-hush press conference puts everyone on edge.

name: Trial 4
overview: Charged as a teen in the 1993 killing of a Boston cop, Sean K. Ellis fights to prove his innocence while exposing police corruption and systemic racism.

episodes.name: Chapter 1: Execution-Style Murder
episodes.overview: In 1993, the execution-style killing of a Boston police officer sets off a frantic citywide search for suspects.

episodes.name: Chapter 2: Usual Suspects
episodes.overview: Police home in on a suspect, a 19-year-old named Sean K. Ellis. Boston journalists and cops recall another murder case that fanned racial tensions.

episodes.name: Chapter 3: Three Trials
episodes.overview: As Ellis and his lawyers recount his first jury trial, former jurors share their decision processes. A witness's statements are put to the test.

episodes.name: Chapter 4: Badge Of Shame
episodes.overview: Journalists expose corruption in the Boston Police Department, inspiring Ellis to seek a new trial and perhaps a new lawyer.

episodes.name: Chapter 5: Hidden Link
episodes.overview: Ellis' attorney, Rosemary Scapicchio, remains dogged in her pursuit of the missing documents that may hold the key to her client getting a new trial.

episodes.name: Chapter 6: A Taste Of Freedom
episodes.overview: Knowing it's his last chance, Ellis nervously prepares for a fourth murder trial. Also, an investigator searches for an old witness.

episodes.name: Chapter 7: Black Irish
episodes.overview: As the voters of Suffolk County prepare to elect their next district attorney, Scapicchio digs into who funded the reward for Ellis' conviction.

episodes.name: Chapter 8: Worst Case Scenario
episodes.overview: The election of a new district attorney gives Ellis reason to hope. Later, a hush-hush press conference puts everyone on edge.
